liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACT Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police. But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis". You can read more about this story here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Bruce Lehrmann inquiry report heavily criticises man who prosecuted the case of 'knowingly lying' to chief justice

featuredLink.title: Bruce Lehrmann inquiry report heavily criticises man who prosecuted the case of 'knowingly lying' to Chief Justice

children.content: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACT
Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police.
But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis".
You can read more about this story here:

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ADF has confirmed unidentified human remains have been found in the search for the MRH-90 helicopter crash that claimed four lives during a military exercise last week. Australian Defence Force Chief of Joint Operations Lieutenant General Greg Bilton says a remotely operated underwater vehicle located a further debris field including parts of the cockpit. "The debris field is consistent with a catastrophic, high impact," he says. "Sadly I can confirm unidentified human remains have also been observed in this location by the remote operated underwater vehicle." They were found 40 metres below the surface. "Due to the nature of the debris field positive identified of the remains is unlikely to occur until we recover more of the wreckage," he said. You can read more on this story here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Human remains and cockpit debris found in search for downed MRH-90 helicopter

featuredLink.title: Human remains found near Taipan helicopter wreckage

children.content: The ADF has confirmed unidentified human remains have been found in the search for the MRH-90 helicopter crash that claimed four lives during a military exercise last week.
Australian Defence Force Chief of Joint Operations Lieutenant General Greg Bilton says a remotely operated underwater vehicle located a further debris field including parts of the cockpit.
"The debris field is consistent with a catastrophic, high impact," he says.
"Sadly I can confirm unidentified human remains have also been observed in this location by the remote operated underwater vehicle."
They were found 40 metres below the surface.
"Due to the nature of the debris field positive identified of the remains is unlikely to occur until we recover more of the wreckage," he said.
You can read more on this story here:

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: An additional 43 charges have been laid against a bus driver who was at the wheel of a coach that crashed in the Hunter Valley, killing 10 people. The bus carrying wedding guests rolled on a roundabout near the Hunter Expressway at Greta in June. The new charges include nine offences each of alleged dangerous and negligent driving occasioning grievous bodily harm. There are also 25 new charges of causing bodily harm by misconduct. You can read more on this story here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Hunter Valley wedding bus crash driver faces 43 additional charges

featuredLink.title: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to face 43 additional charges

children.content: An additional 43 charges have been laid against a bus driver who was at the wheel of a coach that
crashed in the Hunter Valley, killing 10 people.
The bus carrying wedding guests rolled on a roundabout near the Hunter Expressway at Greta in June.
The new charges include nine offences each of alleged dangerous and negligent driving occasioning grievous bodily harm.
There are also 25 new charges of causing bodily harm by misconduct.
You can read more on this story here:
